result.execSummary:
The defendant Silvestre Hilario was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and payment plan fee shall be paid at a rate of $50 per month commencing 1-01-16 and the first of each month until paid in full or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Silvestre Hilario

records.addlTxt: Sent certified copy of JOC via email to Sesini Law per request & payment rec'd 10-26-20

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Resolution reached.  Defendant continues to waive right to counsel.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and imposes a fine of $379 to be paid at a rate of $50 commencing 1-01-16 or judgment.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Defendant has not been able to obtain his DL and is currently working on his residency in the United States.  Defendant requests additional time.  Defendant did meet with ADA Schepper.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def appeared in person.  Intern Samuel Tufford and Atty. Sandra Jo Giernoth for the State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $500 signature bond set. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to counsel and accepts waiver.  Adjourned to allow Defendant to reinstate driver's license.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
